description: Distribution of maximum inversion table entry.
comments: T(n,k) = number of permutations p of [n] such that max(p(i)-i)=k. Example: T(3,0)=1 because for p=123 we have max(p(i)-i)=0; T(3,1)=3 because for p=132, 213, 231 we have max(p(i)-i) =1; T(3,2)=2 because for p=312, 321 we have max(p(i)-i)=2. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Nov 12 2004
references: E. Deutsch and I. M. Gessel, Problem 10634, Amer. Math. Monthly, 107 (2000), 567-568.
R. Sedgewick and Ph. Flajolet, "An Introduction to the Analysis of Algorithms", Addison-Wesley, 1996, ISBN 0-201-40009-X, table 6.10 (page 356)
links: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
maple: T:=proc(n,k) if k>0 and k<=n then k!*(k+1)^(n-k)-(k-1)!*k^(n-k+1) elif k=0 then 1 else 0 fi end: TT:=(n,k)->T(n,k-1): matrix(10,10,TT);
crossrefs: Columns and diagonals give A000225, A056182, A000142, A056197.
